method.name: PUBLIC Decision Tree

reference.ref: R. Rastogi and K. Shim, PUBLIC: A Decision Tree Classifier that Integrates Building and Pruning, Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery, 4 (4):315-344, 2000

generalDescription.objective: To determine a decision tree that on the basis of answers to questions about the input attributes predicts correctly the value of the target attribute
generalDescription.howWork: PUBLIC is a decision tree generating algorithm that generates decision trees from a set of given examples in a unique phase for building and pruning. The decision tree is constructed top-down. In each step a test for the actual node is chosen (starting with the root node), which best separates the given examples by classes. From time to time a pruning period is started which stops the growing of some of the nodes and avoids wasting time on them. PUBLIC is based on the SPRINT and SLIQ algorithms and is recommended for large datasets.

parameterSpec.param: nodesBetweenPrune: Number of nodes processed between calls to the prune procedure
estimateToPrune: Way of estimating the cost of a "yet to be expanded" node in the prune procedure
